SEARCH
Package com.comp2042.controller

Class GuiController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.GuiController
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputHandler.BrickDisplayUpdater, javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GuiController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, InputHandler.BrickDisplayUpdater
Controller for the main game GUI (JavaFX). Manages the display of the game board, bricks, score, next pieces, and overlays. It delegates input handling to InputHandler and game logic events to GameController.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the controller class. This method is automatically called after the fxml file has been loaded.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object.
      resources - The resources used to localize the root object.

    • initGameView

      public void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Initializes the game view with the board matrix and current brick. Sets up the grid of rectangles for the board and the falling brick.
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - The current state of the game board.
      brick - The current falling brick view data.

    • refreshBrick

      public void refreshBrick(ViewData brick)
      Refreshes the brick display with new position and shape data. Part of the BrickDisplayUpdater interface.
      Specified by:
      refreshBrick in interface InputHandler.BrickDisplayUpdater
      Parameters:
      brick - The updated view data for the falling brick.

    • moveDown

      public void moveDown(MoveEvent event)
      Handles downward movement of the brick. Part of the BrickDisplayUpdater interface.
      Specified by:
      moveDown in interface InputHandler.BrickDisplayUpdater
      Parameters:
      event - The move event triggering the down movement.

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      Starts a new game. Part of the BrickDisplayUpdater interface.
      Specified by:

    • refreshGameBackground

      public void refreshGameBackground(int[][] board)
      Refreshes the game board background to reflect the current state of locked bricks.
      Parameters:
      board - The matrix representing the game board.

    • animateClearRows

      public void animateClearRows(List<Integer> rows, Runnable onFinished)
      Animates the clearing of rows.
      Parameters:

      onFinished - A runnable to execute after the animation completes.

      public void setEventListener(InputEventListener eventListener)

      public void setInitialFallSpeed(long speed)

    • setInsaneMode

      public void setInsaneMode(boolean insaneMode)
      Sets whether the game is in Insane Mode.
      Parameters:
      insaneMode - True if Insane Mode is enabled, false otherwise.

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      Handles the Game Over state. Stops the game, plays sound, shows the Game Over panel, and saves the score.

    • newGame

      public void newGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Public method for FXML button binding (if needed). Delegates to the newGame() method from BrickDisplayUpdater interface.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action event triggering the new game.

    • pauseGame

      public void pauseGame()
      Toggles the game pause state. Stops/resumes the animation and music, and shows/hides the pause panel. Part of the BrickDisplayUpdater interface.
      Specified by:
      pauseGame in interface InputHandler.BrickDisplayUpdater
